courses.name: Recital Attendance for Undergraduate Music Majors
courses.description: Required attendance of eleven music events from the Music Department listing. 0 credit, and may be repeated until the total degree requirement is satisfactorily met. No tuition charged.  Graded on S/U basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Undergraduate music or music education majors only

courses.name: Topics in Music-Humanities
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics in music. Subjects and credit variable. May be repeated for additional credit with departmental consent.
courses.prerequisites: junior standing in Music and instructor's consent

courses.name: Topics in Music-Humanities - Honors
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics in music. Subjects and credit variable. May be repeated for additional credit with departmental consent.
courses.prerequisites: junior standing in Music and instructor's consent. Honors eligibility required

courses.name: Problems in Music
courses.description: Independent investigation leading to a paper or project. May be repeated for credit. Sections are: Music Theory, Music Composition, Music History, Music Performance/Pedagogy.

courses.name: Problems in Music - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Independent investigation leading to a paper or project. May be repeated for credit. Sections are: Music Theory, Music Composition, Music History, Music Performance/Pedagogy.

courses.name: Topics in Music-Humanities
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics in music. Subjects and credit variable. May be repeated for additional credit with departmental consent.
courses.prerequisites: junior standing in Music and instructor's consent

courses.name: Topics in Music-Humanities - Honors
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics in music. Subjects and credit variable. May be repeated for additional credit with departmental consent.
courses.prerequisites: junior standing in Music and instructor's consent. Honors eligibility required

courses.name: Topics in Music-Humanities - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics in music. Subjects and credit variable. May be repeated for additional credit with departmental consent.
courses.prerequisites: junior standing in Music and instructor's consent

courses.name: Music Travel Course
courses.description: (cross-leveled with MUS_GENL 7029). Experience designed to broaden music students' perspectives on music in different social and/or cultural context(s). Participant bears cost of the course.

courses.name: Career Development for Musicians
courses.description: Examination of professional opportunities available in the Creative Economy; development of a framework for career planning, professional portfolio, and personal business plan.

courses.name: Principles of Entrepreneurship for Musicians
courses.description: Provisions of a solid foundation of the core principles of entrepreneurial practice:  creation of new ventures, the decisions leading to their development, and the factors that lead to their success.  Students identify a career objective and develop a framework for achieving it.
courses.prerequisites: MUS_GENL 4510; sophomore standing or instructor's consent

courses.name: Arts Marketing for Musicians
courses.description: Exploration of marketing the arts in the 21st Century.  Students formulate a marketing plan for a project or career goal, including establishing a competitive advantage, identifying target markets, formulating marketing strategy, and measuring outcomes.
courses.prerequisites: MUS_GENL 4510; Sophomore standing or instructor's consent

courses.name: Grant Writing for Musicians
courses.description: (cross-leveled with MUS_GENL 7516). Exploration of the nuts and bolts of grant writing, including resources for freelance performers and teachers, and alternative fundraising strategies for individual venture ideas.  Students identify a grant opportunity and draft a funding proposal for a real or imagined project.
courses.prerequisites: MUS_GENL 4510; sophomore standing or instructor's consent

courses.name: Music Industry Survey
courses.description: In-depth survey of the commercial Music industry world, with emphasis on career opportunities within the recording, performing, music retail, and music management sectors.

courses.name: Non-Profit Management in the Arts
courses.description: Introduction to management strategy and its application within the not-for-profit arts sector.
courses.prerequisites: MUS_GENL 4510, sophomore standing or instructor's consent

courses.name: Community Engagement in the Arts
courses.description: Introduction to community-based arts and their relationship to personal branding in the non-profit arts sector.
courses.prerequisites: MUS_GENL 4510, sophomore standing, or instructor's consent

courses.name: Entrepreneurship, Leadership and Advocacy in the Arts
courses.description: Seminar investigating advocacy methods, the application of leadership within non-profit arts organizations, arts policy and implications for artists in the 21st century.  Writing and research-based work is a heavy component.

courses.name: Music Entrepreneurship Practicum
courses.description: (cross-leveled with MUS_GENL 7540).  Students either A) design and execute an entrepreneurial music leadership project in the community, or B) complete an internship (and accompanying report) with an approved partner organization, supervised by the instructor.
courses.prerequisites: MUS_GENL 4510, sophomore standing or instructor's consent

courses.name: Movement and Wellness for Musicians
courses.description: (cross-leveled with MUS_GENL 7550). Students will actively engage with various somatic practices with the goal of holistically improving musical performance.

courses.name: Topics in Music
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics in music. Subjects and credit variable. May be repeated with departmental consent.

courses.name: Research in Music
courses.description: Thesis course. May be repeated for additional credit. Sections are: Music Theory, Music Composition, Music History. Performance/Pedagogy.  Graded on S/U basis only.
